content.question: A chi-square goodness-of-fit test using a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was conducted to investigate whether the number of babies born in a town is uniformly distributed across the months of the year. The test produced a test statistic of <math alttext="chi square equals 5.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>5.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.90. Which of the following is correct?

choices.label: Births are uniformly distributed across months.
There is sufficient evidence to suggest that the distribution of births is not uniformly distributed across months.
There is sufficient evidence to suggest that the distribution of births is uniformly distributed across months.
There is insufficient evidence to suggest that the distribution of births is not uniformly distributed across months.
There is insufficient evidence to suggest that the distribution of births is uniformly distributed across months.

content.answer: There is insufficient evidence to suggest that the distribution of births is not uniformly distributed across months.

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
